text: Forbes Carlile MBE (3 June 1921 - 2 August 2016) was an Australian athlete.Father of Australian Swimming Forbes Carlile Passes Away: Father of Australian Swimming Forbes Carlile Passes Away, accessdate: September 4, 2016 He was Australia's first post-World War II Olympics swimming coach. He was later Australia's first competitor in the modern pentathlon at the 1952 Summer Olympics in Helsinki. He remains the only person to have coached and later competed at the Olympic Games. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2016 deaths Category:1952 Summer Olympics Category:Olympians for Australia Category:Sportspeople from Victoria (Australia)
title: Forbes Carlile
